title: Drawing, "Window Decoration, with Panel of Arabesques and Star, Probably for the Dining Room", 1802
medium: Watercolor, pen and black ink on white wove paper
markings: Stamps: Cooper Union Museum stamp on reverse
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Vertical rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. A tall double-window, flanked by two narrow panels of glass. Lattice-work panels at the sides. The windows are surmounted by a painted tablet with scroll decoration.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory
